perturbation.original_text: 8.00 This IP Agreement imposes personal obligations on Investor. Investor will not assign to any Third Party any rights under this IP Agreement not specifically transferable by its terms without the prior written consent of Company, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld. For the avoidance of doubt and notwithstanding the foregoing: (1) such rights are assignable by Investor to an Affiliate of Investor, and (2) Investor’s rights in Investor Improvements and Joint Improvements shall be freely assignable by Investor to any Person.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.00 This IP Agreement imposes personal obligations on Investor. Investor will not assign to any Third Party any rights under this IP Agreement without the prior written consent of Company, such consent to be withheld at Company's sole discretion. For the avoidance of doubt and notwithstanding the foregoing: (1) such rights are assignable by Investor to an Affiliate of Investor, but only with the express written consent of the Company, and (2) Investor’s rights in Investor Improvements and Joint Improvements shall only be assignable by Investor to another entity, and only for purposes relating to rare earth mineral processing and rare earth separation.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Company's consent to assignment 'not to be unreasonably withheld.' The modified text allows the consent to be 'withheld at Company's sole discretion,' creating a contradiction. Furthermore, the original text allows free assignment of Investor's rights in Investor Improvements and Joint Improvements to any Person, which is now limited in the modified text, creating further confusion.

perturbation.original_text:
16.01 Investor at any time may provide written notice to Company of a material breach of this IP Agreement. If Company fails to cure the identified breach within thirty (30) days after the date of the notice, Investor may terminate this IP Agreement by written notice to Company.

16.02 If the Option is not exercised before the expiration of the Option Period, Company may provide written notice to Investor of a material breach of this IP Agreement. If Investor fails to cure the identified breach within thirty (30) days after the date of the notice, Company may terminate this IP Agreement by written notice to Investor. If the Option is exercised before the expiration of the Option Period, Company may not terminate this IP Agreement for material breach.
perturbation.changed_text:
16.01 Investor at any time may provide written notice to Company of a material breach of this IP Agreement. If Company fails to cure the identified breach within thirty (30) days after the date of the notice, Investor may terminate this IP Agreement by written notice to Company. However, such termination is only valid if the material breach directly affects Investor's rights concerning Patent prosecution.

16.02 If the Option is not exercised before the expiration of the Option Period, Company may provide written notice to Investor of a material breach of this IP Agreement. If Investor fails to cure the identified breach within thirty (30) days after the date of the notice, Company may terminate this IP Agreement by written notice to Investor. If the Option is exercised before the expiration of the Option Period, Company may terminate this IP Agreement for material breach if the breach involves unauthorized disclosure of Technical Information to a Third Party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows Investor to terminate for any material breach, while the modified text restricts termination to breaches affecting patent prosecution. Conversely, Company originally could not terminate after the option was exercised, but now it can if the breach involves unauthorized disclosure. This creates conflicting conditions for termination.

perturbation.original_text: 5.01 Investor shall own all right, title and interest in any Improvement made or acquired by the Investor ("Investor Improvement"). Investor hereby agrees to grant to Company a non-exclusive, irrevocable, royalty-free license under any Investor Improvement and any patent claiming such Investor Improvement, solely for use in rare earth mineral processing and rare earth separation, to make and have made, use, offer to sell, sell and import products made using the Investor Improvements. Such rights to Investor Improvements shall be solely for use by the Company and its Affiliates and shall not be transferable to any Third Party, except in connection with a merger, consolidation, or the sale or transfer of substantially all of Company's assets associated with performance under this IP Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.01 Investor shall own all right, title and interest in any Improvement made or acquired by the Investor ("Investor Improvement"). Investor hereby agrees to grant to Company a non-exclusive, revocable, royalty-free license under any Investor Improvement and any patent claiming such Investor Improvement, solely for use in rare earth mineral processing and rare earth separation, to make and have made, use, offer to sell, sell and import products made using the Investor Improvements. Such rights to Investor Improvements may be used by the Company; however, the Investor retains the right to restrict usage based on the Investor's business interests.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants a non-exclusive, irrevocable license to Company, which is changed to a revocable license in the modified version. The original also restricts the license use by Company and it's affiliates, while the modified license adds that the Investor has the right to restrict usage based on business interest. This introduces a contradiction regarding the license's stability and the Company's ability to rely on it.
